III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following: (a)
Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A is pregnant. She will complain of pain and want to go to
the doctor and staff will say no.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 4/16/2025. Youth C reported Youth A is
pregnant and wanted to go to the hospital and staff (couldn’t
remember who) refused to take her. Youth C did not provide any
further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/21/2025.
Youth A reported she gets what she needs at the facility. Youth A
reported when she asks to go to a doctor, the facility should let
her. Youth A reported one time when her stomach hurt, she was
crying in pain and asked to go to the doctor and was told no by
Supervisor and Team Leader. Youth A reported she told
Supervisor and Team Leader about her stomach pain and they
contacted the facility nurse, who came and saw her. Youth A
reported the nurse talked to her and said that they would keep an
eye on it and instructed her to drink fluids. Youth A could not recall
which nurse it was she saw.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/21/2025.
Youth B reported Youth A was complaining her stomach was
hurting, was crying, and stating she wanted to go to the hospital,
but was not taken. Youth B reported she did not recall which staff
were there or who said no. Youth B reported she did not know if a
nurse saw Youth A or what else was done regarding the stomach
pain.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Supervisor denied Youth A informed him of her
stomach hurting or being in pain. Supervisor denied telling Youth
A she could not go to the doctor or hospital. Supervisor denied
knowledge of other staff denying Youth A medical care.
Supervisor reported recalling a time Youth A was throwing up and
having trouble keeping food down and stated the nurse was
contacted to see her for this. Supervisor reported Youth A was
given a nausea pill for this as well as Benadryl. Supervisor was
not able to recall if she also went to the doctor for this concern.
Supervisor reported remembering when Youth A first arrived at
the facility she asked to go to the doctor and recalls one of the
nurses saw her.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/21/2025.
Staff 1 denied Youth A asking to go to the doctor or hospital and
being told that she could not. Staff 1 reported Youth A complained
2

to her there was a past day she wanted to go to the doctor and
was not taken. Staff 1 reported she asked Youth A at that time if
she was seen by a nurse and Youth A did not respond to the
question but said she had wanted to go to a doctor. Staff 1 denied
that she was reporting pain or concern at the time of their
conversation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/21/2025.
Staff 2 reported she has head Youth A complain of pain. Staff 2
reported when this occurs, she will ask her where the pain is, how
long she’s had the pain, has she taken anything, and contact the
facility nurse to see her. Staff 2 denied Youth A ever asking to be
taken to the doctor or hospital.
Team Leader was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/21/2025. Team Leader reported when Youth A first arrived at
the facility, she complained of stomach aches at which time the
nurse was contacted and saw her. Team Leader denied
awareness of Youth A asking to go to the doctor or hospital and
being told no.
Documents Reviewed:
- Nurse’s notes #1-#7 documents nurse calls between 3/1/25
and 4/22/25 for Youth A.
o Note 1 dated 3/1/25 and Note 2 dated 3/3/25
document questions about discharge followed by
denial of ongoing pain.
o Note 3 dated 3/17/25 documents complaint of
tingling hands and feet. Document states a doctor
was consulted who recommended observation and
to stay hydrated. Youth was also scheduled to see a
doctor.
o Note 4 dated 3/17/25 is follow up to Note 3. The
doctor was contacted again as Youth A stated she
did not want to see this doctor and it is noted Youth
A hung up on the nurse. Note 4 documents a visit
with a doctor, reflecting no concerns.
o Note 6 dated 4/3/25 documents complaint of
stomach pain, no spotting or discharge noted.
Doctor’s instructions noted to monitor and
encourage hydration.
o Note 7 dated 4/5/25 documents complaint of
nausea. Doctor instruction is noted to monitor,
encourage hydration, rest, and to eat when able.
- Obstetrics Report for Youth A dated 3/21/25 documented
counseling being given on measures for nausea and
insomnia.
3

- Obstetrics Record for Youth A dated 3/21/25 included
confirmation of pregnancy, nothing no irregularities or
concerns.
- Obstetrics Report for Youth A dated 4/7/25 detailed a
normal ultrasound.
- Pregnant and Parenting Clients POL-006-041 states the
needs of the clients are to be monitored and administered
consultation with health services.
- Client Health Services POL-008-001 states: when the need
for specialized health services is identified, referrals will be
made to the appropriate healthcare practitioner. Such
services may encompass obstetrics and gynecology,
orthopedics, endocrinology, cardiology, dermatology,
audiology, etc. Pregnant clients will be referred to obstetrics
for prenatal care.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews completed,
and documentation reviewed, Youth A reported she received
medical attention from a nurse at the facility following complaining
of stomach pain. Staff consistently reported addressing complaints
of pain or health concerns by Youth A through referral to nursing
staff. Nurse and Obstetric documentation shows consistent
appointments, follow up, and consultation with doctors.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
